It has not been therefore without surprise, which I 
have no doubt will be shared by the Society, that 
I have lately found that Laplace’s explanation of 
the phenomenon in question is essentially incomplete,
& that the numerical results of Damoiseau’s & Plana’s
theories, with reference to it, consequently require 
to be very sensibly altered.
Laplace’s explanation may be briefly stated as follows.
He shows that the mean central disturbing force of the 
Sun, by which the Moon’s gravity towards the Earth 
is diminished, depends not only on the Sun’s mean 
distance, but also on the eccentricity of the Earth’s orbit.
